caption: Actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell were spotted wearing Donald Trump campaign shirts.

candidates.title: Is This a Photograph of Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell in Donald Trump Campaign Shirts?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell were spotted wearing Donald Trump campaign shirts.
Rating:
False
About this rating
In late April 2016, the above-reproduced image began circulating on social media, ostensibly showing actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell proudly sporting Donald Trump shirts.
At first glance, the photograph wasn't very convincing because of the contrast between the overlaid imagery and t-shirt fabric. It was fairly easy to prove the image was edited, as it first appeared in mid-2015 (without Trump details):
Even if the photograph's editing weren't so sloppy, the existence of the older original photograph gave the hoax away — it's incredibly unlikely paparazzi could have snapped identical (down to the facial expressions) images of Russell and Hawn in both mid-2015 and early 2016.
candidates.description: An image of actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell wearing Donald Trump campaign shirts is a digital fabrication.

result.explanation: This assessment is evidence-based. The provided Snopes article directly addresses the claim that actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell wore Donald Trump campaign shirts.  The article definitively rates this claim as FALSE, presenting evidence that the image circulating online is a digitally fabricated hoax. The original image predates Trump's campaign, and the superimposed Trump elements are poorly done.  Therefore, the news caption is inaccurate.
supporting_evidence: Source 1: Snopes article: https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/goldie-hawn-kurt-russell-trump/  -  The Snopes article concludes that the image of Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell wearing Trump shirts is a digital fabrication and false.

Source 1: Snopes article content: "In late April 2016, the above-reproduced image began circulating on social media, ostensibly showing actors Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell proudly sporting Donald Trump shirts. At first glance, the photograph wasn't very convincing because of the contrast between the overlaid imagery and t-shirt fabric. It was fairly easy to prove the image was edited, as it first appeared in mid-2015 (without Trump details). Even if the photograph's editing weren't so sloppy, the existence of the older original photograph gave the hoax away — it's incredibly unlikely paparazzi could have snapped identical (down to the facial expressions) images of Russell and Hawn in both mid-2015 and early 2016."
